metadata.title: USN-2737-1 -- Linux kernel (Vivid HWE) vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that an integer overflow error existed in the SCSI generic (sg) driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker with write permission to a SCSI generic device could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially escalate their privileges.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-2737-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-3.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-28.30~14.04.1 linux-image-3.19.0-28-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-28.30~14.04.1 linux-image-3.19.0-28-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-28.30~14.04.1 linux-image-3.19.0-28-lowlatency - 3.19.0-28.30~14.04.1 linux-image-3.19.0-28-generic - 3.19.0-28.30~14.04.1 linux-image-extra-3.19.0-28-generic - 3.19.0-28.30~14.04.1 linux-image-3.19.0-28-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-28.30~14.04.1 linux-image-3.19.0-28-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-28.30~14.04.1 No subscription required
